verses.verse: There is <WH3426> an evil <WH7451> which I have seen <WH7200> under the sun <WH8121>, and it is heavy <WH7227> upon men <WH120>:

a man <WH376> to whom God <WH430> giveth <WH5414> riches <WH6239>, wealth <WH6239>, and honor <WH3519>, so that he lacketh <WH2638> nothing for his soul <WH5315> of all that he desireth <WH183>, yet God <WH430> giveth him not power <WH7980> to eat <WH398> thereof <WH376>, but an alien eateth <WH398> it <WH1892>; this is vanity, and it is an evil <WH7451> disease <WH2483>.

If a man <WH376> beget <WH3205> a hundred <WH3967> children <WH2421>, and live many <WH7227> years <WH8141>, so that the days <WH3117> of his years <WH8141> are many <WH7227>, but his soul <WH5315> be not filled <WH7646> with good <WH2896>, and moreover he have no burial <WH6900>; I say <WH559>, that an untimely birth <WH5309> is better than he <WH2896>:
for it cometh <WH935> in vanity <WH1892>, and departeth <WH3212> in darkness <WH2822>, and the name <WH8034> thereof is covered <WH3680> with darkness <WH2822>;
moreover it hath not seen <WH7200> the sun <WH8121> nor known <WH3045> it <WH2088>; this hath rest <WH5183> rather than the other <WH2088>:
yea <WH432>, though he live <WH2421> a thousand <WH505> years <WH8141> twice <WH6471> told <WH7200>, and yet enjoy no good <WH2896>, do not all go <WH1980> to one <WH259> place <WH4725>?
All the labor <WH5999> of man <WH120> is for his mouth <WH6310>, and yet the appetite <WH5315> is not filled <WH4390>.
For what advantage hath the wise <WH2450> more <WH3148> than the fool <WH3684>? or what hath the poor <WH6041> man <WH3045>, that knoweth how to walk <WH1980> before the living <WH2416>?
Better <WH2896> is the sight <WH4758> of the eyes <WH5869> than the wandering <WH1980> of the desire <WH5315>: this also is vanity <WH1892> and a striving <WH7469> after wind <WH7307>.

Whatsoever hath been <WH7121>, the name thereof was given long ago <WH3528>; and it is known <WH3045> what man <WH120> is <WH3201>; neither can he contend <WH1777> with him that is mightier than he <WH8623>.
Seeing there are <WH3426> many <WH7235> things <WH1697> that increase <WH7235> vanity <WH1892>, what is man <WH120> the better <WH3148>?

For who knoweth <WH3045> what is good <WH2896> for man <WH120> in his life <WH2416>, all <WH4557> the days <WH3117> of his vain <WH1892> life <WH2416> which he spendeth <WH6213> as a shadow <WH6738>? for who can tell <WH5046> a man <WH120> what shall be after <WH310> him under the sun <WH8121>?
